summary.para: Creates a new web part category.

summary.para: Initializes a connection to the Kentico CMS Server.
The Initialize-CMSApplication cmdlet initializes a connection to the Kentico CMS server.
If this cmdlet is run without parameters, then it requires administrator permissions to find the Kentico site.
It does so by performing the following steps:
1. Get a list of all the sites from IIS.
2. Get a list of all applications from the sites.
3. Get a list of all the virtual directories from the applications.
4. Continue processing virtual directory if a web.config file exits.
5. Parse the document and find an "add" node with name="CMSConnectionString".
6. If the connection string is valid, then stop processing.

example.para: Initialize the Kentico CMS Application by searching for the Kentico site.
This option requires administrator rights.
Initialize the Kentico CMS Application by using the specified connection string.
This option does not require administrator rights.

summary.para: Use the previous successful site and connection string information found.
If none, then this is the same as supplying no parameters.
The connection string for the database connection.
The database server to use for generating the connection string.
The database to use for generating the connection string.
The timeout to use for generating the connection string.
The root directory for the Kentico site.
